question: For the reaction <katex>$PCl_{5}\rightarrow PCl_{3}+Cl_{2}$</katex>, rate and rate constant are <katex>$1.02\times10^{-4}molL^{-1}s^{-1}$</katex> and <katex>$3.4\times10^{-5}s^{-1}$</katex> respectively at a given instant. The molar concentration of <katex>$PCl_{5}$</katex> at that instant is: [cite: 358-359]
explanation: Rate = k[Concentration]. Concentration = Rate / k = <katex>$\frac{1.02\times10^{-4}}{3.4\times10^{-5}} = 3.0$</katex> mol/L. [cite: 363, 364]
